TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit MessageQueuePermissionEntry extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines the smallest unit of a code access security permission set for messaging.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information, see [Code Access Security](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/23a20143-241d-4fe5-9d9f-3933fd594c03).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of MessageQueuePermissionEntry.
[!code-cpp[MessageQueuePermissionEntry#0](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.messaging.messa_5_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[MessageQueuePermissionEntry#0](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.messaging.messa_5_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Messaging.MessageQueuePermissionAccess permissionAccess, string path) cil managed

Docs.param: A bitwise combination of the values. The <xref:System.Messaging.MessageQueuePermissionEntry.PermissionAccess%2A> property is set to this value.
The path of the queue that is referenced by the object. The <xref:System.Messaging.MessageQueuePermissionEntry.Path%2A> property is set to this value.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified permission access levels and the path of the queue.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example creates a new instance of <xref:System.Messaging.MessageQueuePermissionEntry>.
[!code-cpp[MessageQueuePermissionEntry#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/1a5cae42-69bd-4274-8a33-_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[MessageQueuePermissionEntry#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/1a5cae42-69bd-4274-8a33-_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public MessageQueuePermissionEntry (System.Messaging.MessageQueuePermissionAccess permissionAccess, string machineName, string label, string category);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Messaging.MessageQueuePermissionAccess permissionAccess, string machineName, string label, string category) cil managed

Docs.param: A bitwise combination of the values. The <xref:System.Messaging.MessageQueuePermissionEntry.PermissionAccess%2A> property is set to this value.
The name of the computer where the Message Queuing queue is located. The <xref:System.Messaging.MessageQueuePermissionEntry.MachineName%2A> property is set to this value.
The queue description. The <xref:System.Messaging.MessageQueuePermissionEntry.Label%2A> property is set to this value.
The queue category (Message Queuing type identifier). The <xref:System.Messaging.MessageQueuePermissionEntry.Category%2A> property is set to this value.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified permission access levels, the name of the computer where the queue is located, the queue description, and the queue category.

remarks.format:

Docs.value: The queue category (Message Queuing type identifier), which allows an application to categorize its queues.
